BitField.name: CECEN
BitField.description: CEC Enable The CECEN bit is set and cleared by software. CECEN=1 starts message reception and enables the TXSOM control. CECEN=0 disables the CEC peripheral, clears all bits of CEC_CR register and aborts any on-going reception or transmission.

BitField.name: TXSOM
BitField.description: Tx Start Of Message TXSOM is set by software to command transmission of the first byte of a CEC message. If the CEC message consists of only one byte, TXEOM must be set before of TXSOM. Start-Bit is effectively started on the CEC line after SFT is counted. If TXSOM is set while a message reception is ongoing, transmission will start after the end of reception. TXSOM is cleared by hardware after the last byte of the message is sent with a positive acknowledge (TXEND=1), in case of transmission underrun (TXUDR=1), negative acknowledge (TXACKE=1), and transmission error (TXERR=1). It is also cleared by CECEN=0. It is not cleared and transmission is automatically retried in case of arbitration lost (ARBLST=1). TXSOM can be also used as a status bit informing application whether any transmission request is pending or under execution. The application can abort a transmission request at any time by clearing the CECEN bit. Note: TXSOM must be set when CECEN=1 TXSOM must be set when transmission data is available into TXDR HEADERs first four bits containing own peripheral address are taken from TXDR[7:4], not from CEC_CFGR.OAR which is used only for reception

BitField.name: TXEOM
BitField.description: Tx End Of Message The TXEOM bit is set by software to command transmission of the last byte of a CEC message. TXEOM is cleared by hardware at the same time and under the same conditions as for TXSOM. Note: TXEOM must be set when CECEN=1 TXEOM must be set before writing transmission data to TXDR If TXEOM is set when TXSOM=0, transmitted message will consist of 1 byte (HEADER) only (PING message)

Register.name: CEC_CFGR
Register.description: This register is used to configure the HDMI-CEC controller. It is mandatory to write CEC_CFGR only when CECEN=0.

BitField.name: SFT
BitField.description: Signal Free Time SFT bits are set by software. In the SFT=0x0 configuration the number of nominal data bit periods waited before transmission is ruled by hardware according to the transmission history. In all the other configurations the SFT number is determined by software. * 0x0 ** 2.5 Data-Bit periods if CEC is the last bus initiator with unsuccessful transmission (ARBLST=1, TXERR=1, TXUDR=1 or TXACKE= 1) ** 4 Data-Bit periods if CEC is the new bus initiator ** 6 Data-Bit periods if CEC is the last bus initiator with successful transmission (TXEOM=1) * 0x1: 0.5 nominal data bit periods * 0x2: 1.5 nominal data bit periods * 0x3: 2.5 nominal data bit periods * 0x4: 3.5 nominal data bit periods * 0x5: 4.5 nominal data bit periods * 0x6: 5.5 nominal data bit periods * 0x7: 6.5 nominal data bit periods

BitField.name: RXTOL
BitField.description: Rx-Tolerance The RXTOL bit is set and cleared by software. ** Start-Bit, +/- 200 s rise, +/- 200 s fall. ** Data-Bit: +/- 200 s rise. +/- 350 s fall. ** Start-Bit: +/- 400 s rise, +/- 400 s fall ** Data-Bit: +/-300 s rise, +/- 500 s fall

BitField.name: BRESTP
BitField.description: Rx-Stop on Bit Rising Error The BRESTP bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BREGEN
BitField.description: Generate Error-Bit on Bit Rising Error The BREGEN bit is set and cleared by software. Note: If BRDNOGEN=0, an Error-bit is generated upon BRE detection with BRESTP=1 in broadcast even if BREGEN=0

BitField.name: LBPEGEN
BitField.description: Generate Error-Bit on Long Bit Period Error The LBPEGEN bit is set and cleared by software. Note: If BRDNOGEN=0, an Error-bit is generated upon LBPE detection in broadcast even if LBPEGEN=0

BitField.name: BRDNOGEN
BitField.description: Avoid Error-Bit Generation in Broadcast The BRDNOGEN bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: SFTOPT
BitField.description: SFT Option Bit The SFTOPT bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: OAR
BitField.description: Own addresses configuration The OAR bits are set by software to select which destination logical addresses has to be considered in receive mode. Each bit, when set, enables the CEC logical address identified by the given bit position. At the end of HEADER reception, the received destination address is compared with the enabled addresses. In case of matching address, the incoming message is acknowledged and received. In case of non-matching address, the incoming message is received only in listen mode (LSTN=1), but without acknowledge sent. Broadcast messages are always received. Example: OAR = 0b000 0000 0010 0001 means that CEC acknowledges addresses 0x0 and 0x5. Consequently, each message directed to one of these addresses is received.

BitField.name: LSTN
BitField.description: Listen mode LSTN bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TXD
BitField.description: Tx Data register. TXD is a write-only register containing the data byte to be transmitted. Note: TXD must be written when TXSTART=1

BitField.name: RXD
BitField.description: Rx Data register. RXD is read-only and contains the last data byte which has been received from the CEC line.

BitField.name: RXBR
BitField.description: Rx-Byte Received The RXBR bit is set by hardware to inform application that a new byte has been received from the CEC line and stored into the RXD buffer. RXBR is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: RXEND
BitField.description: End Of Reception RXEND is set by hardware to inform application that the last byte of a CEC message is received from the CEC line and stored into the RXD buffer. RXEND is set at the same time of RXBR. RXEND is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: RXOVR
BitField.description: Rx-Overrun RXOVR is set by hardware if RXBR is not yet cleared at the time a new byte is received on the CEC line and stored into RXD. RXOVR assertion stops message reception so that no acknowledge is sent. In case of broadcast, a negative acknowledge is sent. RXOVR is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: BRE
BitField.description: Rx-Bit Rising Error BRE is set by hardware in case a Data-Bit waveform is detected with Bit Rising Error. BRE is set either at the time the misplaced rising edge occurs, or at the end of the maximum BRE tolerance allowed by RXTOL, in case rising edge is still longing. BRE stops message reception if BRESTP=1. BRE generates an Error-Bit on the CEC line if BREGEN=1. BRE is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: SBPE
BitField.description: Rx-Short Bit Period Error SBPE is set by hardware in case a Data-Bit waveform is detected with Short Bit Period Error. SBPE is set at the time the anticipated falling edge occurs. SBPE generates an Error-Bit on the CEC line. SBPE is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: LBPE
BitField.description: Rx-Long Bit Period Error LBPE is set by hardware in case a Data-Bit waveform is detected with Long Bit Period Error. LBPE is set at the end of the maximum bit-extension tolerance allowed by RXTOL, in case falling edge is still longing. LBPE always stops reception of the CEC message. LBPE generates an Error-Bit on the CEC line if LBPEGEN=1. In case of broadcast, Error-Bit is generated even in case of LBPEGEN=0. LBPE is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: RXACKE
BitField.description: Rx-Missing Acknowledge In receive mode, RXACKE is set by hardware to inform application that no acknowledge was seen on the CEC line. RXACKE applies only for broadcast messages and in listen mode also for not directly addressed messages (destination address not enabled in OAR). RXACKE aborts message reception. RXACKE is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: ARBLST
BitField.description: Arbitration Lost ARBLST is set by hardware to inform application that CEC device is switching to reception due to arbitration lost event following the TXSOM command. ARBLST can be due either to a contending CEC device starting earlier or starting at the same time but with higher HEADER priority. After ARBLST assertion TXSOM bit keeps pending for next transmission attempt. ARBLST is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: TXBR
BitField.description: Tx-Byte Request TXBR is set by hardware to inform application that the next transmission data has to be written to TXDR. TXBR is set when the 4th bit of currently transmitted byte is sent. Application must write the next byte to TXDR within 6 nominal data-bit periods before transmission underrun error occurs (TXUDR). TXBR is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: TXEND
BitField.description: End of Transmission TXEND is set by hardware to inform application that the last byte of the CEC message has been successfully transmitted. TXEND clears the TXSOM and TXEOM control bits. TXEND is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: TXUDR
BitField.description: Tx-Buffer Underrun In transmission mode, TXUDR is set by hardware if application was not in time to load TXDR before of next byte transmission. TXUDR aborts message transmission and clears TXSOM and TXEOM control bits. TXUDR is cleared by software write at 1

BitField.name: TXERR
BitField.description: Tx-Error In transmission mode, TXERR is set by hardware if the CEC initiator detects low impedance on the CEC line while it is released. TXERR aborts message transmission and clears TXSOM and TXEOM controls. TXERR is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: TXACKE
BitField.description: Tx-Missing Acknowledge Error In transmission mode, TXACKE is set by hardware to inform application that no acknowledge was received. In case of broadcast transmission, TXACKE informs application that a negative acknowledge was received. TXACKE aborts message transmission and clears TXSOM and TXEOM controls. TXACKE is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: RXBRIE
BitField.description: Rx-Byte Received Interrupt Enable The RXBRIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: RXENDIE
BitField.description: End Of Reception Interrupt Enable The RXENDIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: RXOVRIE
BitField.description: Rx-Buffer Overrun Interrupt Enable The RXOVRIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BREIE
BitField.description: Bit Rising Error Interrupt Enable The BREIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: SBPEIE
BitField.description: Short Bit Period Error Interrupt Enable The SBPEIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: LBPEIE
BitField.description: Long Bit Period Error Interrupt Enable The LBPEIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: RXACKIE
BitField.description: Rx-Missing Acknowledge Error Interrupt Enable The RXACKIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: ARBLSTIE
BitField.description: Arbitration Lost Interrupt Enable The ARBLSTIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TXBRIE
BitField.description: Tx-Byte Request Interrupt Enable The TXBRIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TXENDIE
BitField.description: Tx-End Of Message Interrupt Enable The TXENDIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TXUDRIE
BitField.description: Tx-Underrun Interrupt Enable The TXUDRIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TXERRIE
BitField.description: Tx-Error Interrupt Enable The TXERRIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TXACKIE
BitField.description: Tx-Missing Acknowledge Error Interrupt Enable The TXACKEIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: EN1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC channel1.

BitField.name: TSEL1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 trigger selection These bits select the external event used to trigger DAC channel1. Note: Only used if bit TEN1 = 1 (DAC channel1 trigger enabled).

BitField.name: WAVE1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 noise/triangle wave generation enable These bits are set and cleared by software. Note: Only used if bit TEN1 = 1 (DAC channel1 trigger enabled).

BitField.name: MAMP1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 mask/amplitude selector These bits are written by software to select mask in wave generation mode or amplitude in triangle generation mode. = 1011: Unmask bits[11:0] of LFSR/ triangle amplitude equal to 4095

BitField.name: DMAEN1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 DMA enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: DMAUDRIE1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 DMA Underrun Interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: CEN1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 calibration enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC channel 1 calibration, it can be written only if bit EN1=0 into DAC_CR (the calibration mode can be entered/exit only when the DAC channel is disabled) Otherwise, the write operation is ignored.

BitField.name: EN2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC channel2.

BitField.name: TSEL2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 trigger selection These bits select the external event used to trigger DAC channel2 Note: Only used if bit TEN2 = 1 (DAC channel2 trigger enabled).

BitField.name: WAVE2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 noise/triangle wave generation enable These bits are set/reset by software. 1x: Triangle wave generation enabled Note: Only used if bit TEN2 = 1 (DAC channel2 trigger enabled)

BitField.name: MAMP2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 mask/amplitude selector These bits are written by software to select mask in wave generation mode or amplitude in triangle generation mode. = 1011: Unmask bits[11:0] of LFSR/ triangle amplitude equal to 4095

BitField.name: DMAEN2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 DMA enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: DMAUDRIE2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 DMA underrun interrupt enable This bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: CEN2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 calibration enable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable DAC channel 2 calibration, it can be written only if bit EN2=0 into DAC_CR (the calibration mode can be entered/exit only when the DAC channel is disabled) Otherwise, the write operation is ignored.

BitField.name: SWTRIG1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 software trigger This bit is set by software to trigger the DAC in software trigger mode. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware (one APB1 clock cycle later) once the DAC_DHR1 register value has been loaded into the DAC_DOR1 register.

BitField.name: SWTRIG2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 software trigger This bit is set by software to trigger the DAC in software trigger mode. Note: This bit is cleared by hardware (one APB1 clock cycle later) once the DAC_DHR2 register value has been loaded into the DAC_DOR2 register.

Register.name: DAC_DHR12R1
Register.description: DAC channel1 12-bit right-aligned data holding register

BitField.name: DACC1DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel1 12-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel1.

Register.name: DAC_DHR12L1
Register.description: DAC channel1 12-bit left aligned data holding register

BitField.name: DACC1DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel1 12-bit left-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel1.

Register.name: DAC_DHR8R1
Register.description: DAC channel1 8-bit right aligned data holding register

BitField.name: DACC1DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel1 8-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 8-bit data for DAC channel1.

Register.name: DAC_DHR12R2
Register.description: DAC channel2 12-bit right aligned data holding register

BitField.name: DACC2DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 12-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel2.

Register.name: DAC_DHR12L2
Register.description: DAC channel2 12-bit left aligned data holding register

BitField.name: DACC2DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 12-bit left-aligned data These bits are written by software which specify 12-bit data for DAC channel2.

Register.name: DAC_DHR8R2
Register.description: DAC channel2 8-bit right-aligned data holding register

BitField.name: DACC2DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 8-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 8-bit data for DAC channel2.

Register.name: DAC_DHR12RD
Register.description: Dual DAC 12-bit right-aligned data holding register

BitField.name: DACC1DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel1 12-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel1.

BitField.name: DACC2DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 12-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel2.

Register.name: DAC_DHR12LD
Register.description: DUAL DAC 12-bit left aligned data holding register

BitField.name: DACC1DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel1 12-bit left-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel1.

BitField.name: DACC2DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 12-bit left-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 12-bit data for DAC channel2.

Register.name: DAC_DHR8RD
Register.description: DUAL DAC 8-bit right aligned data holding register

BitField.name: DACC1DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel1 8-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 8-bit data for DAC channel1.

BitField.name: DACC2DHR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 8-bit right-aligned data These bits are written by software which specifies 8-bit data for DAC channel2.

BitField.name: DACC1DOR
BitField.description: DAC channel1 data output These bits are read-only, they contain data output for DAC channel1.

BitField.name: DACC2DOR
BitField.description: DAC channel2 data output These bits are read-only, they contain data output for DAC channel2.

BitField.name: DMAUDR1
BitField.description: DAC channel1 DMA underrun flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared by software (by writing it to 1).

BitField.name: CAL_FLAG1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 calibration offset status This bit is set and cleared by hardware

BitField.name: BWST1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 busy writing sample time flag This bit is systematically set just after Sample & Hold mode enable and is set each time the software writes the register DAC_SHSR1, It is cleared by hardware when the write operation of DAC_SHSR1 is complete. (It takes about 3LSI periods of synchronization).

BitField.name: DMAUDR2
BitField.description: DAC channel2 DMA underrun flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared by software (by writing it to 1).

BitField.name: CAL_FLAG2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 calibration offset status This bit is set and cleared by hardware

BitField.name: BWST2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 busy writing sample time flag This bit is systematically set just after Sample & Hold mode enable and is set each time the software writes the register DAC_SHSR2, It is cleared by hardware when the write operation of DAC_SHSR2 is complete. (It takes about 3 LSI periods of synchronization).

BitField.name: MODE1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 mode These bits can be written only when the DAC is disabled and not in the calibration mode (when bit EN1=0 and bit CEN1 =0 in the DAC_CR register). If EN1=1 or CEN1 =1 the write operation is ignored. They can be set and cleared by software to select the DAC Channel 1 mode: DAC Channel 1 in normal Mode DAC Channel 1 in sample & hold mode

BitField.name: MODE2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 mode These bits can be written only when the DAC is disabled and not in the calibration mode (when bit EN2=0 and bit CEN2 =0 in the DAC_CR register). If EN2=1 or CEN2 =1 the write operation is ignored. They can be set and cleared by software to select the DAC Channel 2 mode: DAC Channel 2 in normal Mode DAC Channel 2 in sample & hold mode

Register.name: DAC_SHSR1
Register.description: DAC Sample and Hold sample time register 1

BitField.name: TSAMPLE1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 sample Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) These bits can be written when the DAC channel1 is disabled or also during normal operation. in the latter case, the write can be done only when BWSTx of DAC_SR register is low, If BWSTx=1, the write operation is ignored.

Register.name: DAC_SHSR2
Register.description: DAC Sample and Hold sample time register 2

BitField.name: TSAMPLE2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 sample Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) These bits can be written when the DAC channel2 is disabled or also during normal operation. in the latter case, the write can be done only when BWSTx of DAC_SR register is low, if BWSTx=1, the write operation is ignored.

Register.name: DAC_SHHR
Register.description: DAC Sample and Hold hold time register

BitField.name: THOLD1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 hold Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) Hold time= (THOLD[9:0]) x T LSI

BitField.name: THOLD2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 hold time (only valid in sample & hold mode). Hold time= (THOLD[9:0]) x T LSI

Register.name: DAC_SHRR
Register.description: DAC Sample and Hold refresh time register

BitField.name: TREFRESH1
BitField.description: DAC Channel 1 refresh Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) Refresh time= (TREFRESH[7:0]) x T LSI

BitField.name: TREFRESH2
BitField.description: DAC Channel 2 refresh Time (only valid in sample & hold mode) Refresh time= (TREFRESH[7:0]) x T LSI

BitField.name: HEAD10R
BitField.description: 10-bit address header only read direction (master receiver mode)

BitField.name: HEAD10R
BitField.description: 10-bit address header only read direction (master receiver mode)

BitField.name: CALP
BitField.description: Increase frequency of RTC by 488.5 ppm

BitField.name: SUBFS
BitField.description: Subtract a fraction of a second

BitField.name: DU
BitField.description: Date units or day in BCD format

BitField.name: MASKSS
BitField.description: Mask the most-significant bits starting at this bit

BitField.name: DU
BitField.description: Date units or day in BCD format

BitField.name: MASKSS
BitField.description: Mask the most-significant bits starting at this bit

BitField.name: ENVR
BitField.description: Voltage reference buffer mode enable This bit is used to enable the voltage reference buffer mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Internal voltage reference mode disable (external voltage reference mode).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Internal voltage reference mode (reference buffer enable or hold mode) enable.

BitField.name: HIZ
BitField.description: High impedance mode This bit controls the analog switch to connect or not the VREF+ pin. Refer to for the mode descriptions depending on ENVR bit configuration.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: VREF+ pin is internally connected to the voltage reference buffer output.

BitField.name: VRS
BitField.description: Voltage reference scale This bit selects the value generated by the voltage reference buffer.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Voltage reference set to VREF_OUT1 (around 2.048 V).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Voltage reference set to VREF_OUT2 (around 2.5 V).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: the voltage reference buffer output is not ready.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: the voltage reference buffer output reached the requested level.

BitField.name: TRIM
BitField.description: Trimming code These bits are automatically initialized after reset with the trimming value stored in the Flash memory during the production test. Writing into these bits allows the tuning of the internal reference buffer voltage.

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SYST_CVR when the counter is enabled and when it reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: The current value of the SysTick counter

BitField.name: NOREF
BitField.description: Indicates whether the device provides a reference clock to the processor

BitField.name: SKEW
BitField.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value for 10ms (100Hz) timing, subject to system clock skew errors

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

BitField.name: IREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU instruction regions

BitField.name: DREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU data regions

BitField.name: SEPARATE
BitField.description: Support for unified or separate instruction and date memory maps

BitField.name: PRIVDEFENA
BitField.description: Enables privileged software access to the default memory map

BitField.name: HFNMIENA
BitField.description: Enable the operation of MPU during hard fault, NMI, and FAULTMASK handlers

BitField.name: REGION
BitField.description: Indicates the MPU region referenced by the MPU_RBAR and MPU_RASR registers

Register.name: MPU_RASR
Register.description: MPU Region Attribute and Size Register
